title: Consider moving the Solr Reference Guide from Confluence to the ASF CMS
description:
In the context of enabling Confluence shortcut link functionality (SOLR-5965), Joe Schaefer mentioned on #asfinfra that the ASF CMS can emulate all Confluence features, including PDF export, and that we should consider switching the Solr Reference Guide from Confluence to the ASF CMS.  See the transcript at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SOLR-5965?focusedCommentId=13969869&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13969869.

Joe says that http://thrift.apache.org is a good example of a CMS-driven website - more info on this blog post: http://blogs.apache.org/infra/entry/scaling_down_the_cms_to.

comments.author: Mark Miller
comments.content:
http://thrift.apache.org

How cool would it be if our website was that minimal.
